docs.title: Natural Weapons / Armor
docs.text: The character is born with innate weapons and natural protection, fully integrated into their body and fighting style. Effect: The character possesses Category 1 natural weapons and Category 1 natural armor, and is trained in the use of both.

docs.title: Stronger Natural Weapons
docs.text: The character's natural weapons are more developed and deadly than average. Effect: The character's natural weapons are upgraded to Category 2. The character is trained in their use.

docs.title: Stronger Natural Armor
docs.text: The character's hide, scales, or shell offer enhanced protection. Effect: The character's natural armor is upgraded to Category 2. The character is trained in its use.

docs.title: Hardness
docs.text: The character's body is dense and resistant to impact. Effect: Physical Protection is increased by +1, and the character can sustain one additional scratch wound.

docs.title: Unyielding Bulk
docs.text: The character's massive build allows them to carry far more than most. Effect: Bulk capacity is increased by +2, and total bulk capacity is increased by +4.

docs.title: Teamworker
docs.text: The character thrives when acting alongside others. Effect: Once per scene, the character may reroll a test when helping an ally. Allies may also reroll when helping the character.

docs.title: Good Company
docs.text: The character's presence uplifts those around them. Effect: Once per day, after spending at least a short period of time with someone, the character may grant that person temporary Karma Points lasting until the end of a full cycle. This cannot be used on self and does not stack. Allies resting near the character gain +1 Recovery, which also applies to the character if at least one ally benefits.

docs.title: An Ally in Each City
docs.text: The character's community extends far and wide. Effect: In any city of at least 1,000 inhabitants, the character knows at least one ally from their community. This ally can provide limited, non-burdensome assistance at the GM's discretion.

docs.title: Hunter's Edge
docs.text: The character strikes with lethal efficiency when hunting or using natural weapons. Effect: The character may reroll tests made with natural weapons, or when hunting a proper target using hunting weapons.

docs.title: Blood Lust
docs.text: Wounding foes fuels the character's endurance. Effect: When the character deals Vitality damage with a melee or close-combat attack, they recover 1 Endurance (PE) for every 3 Vitality points inflicted (subject to Fatigue).

docs.title: Blood Critical
docs.text: The character's critical strikes exploit existing wounds with savage precision. Effect: The character's critical combat actions gain a bonus to the roll equal to the target's wound level.

docs.title: Survivorability
docs.text: The character remains harder to bring down as long as they are not stunned or shocked. Effect: While not shocked, passive defenses are increased by +1 when armored, or +2 when unarmored (natural armor does not count as armor).

docs.title: Hunter
docs.text: The character pierces defenses with ruthless efficiency. Effect: The character ignores one category of natural armor. All weapons gain +1 minimum die value, and natural weapons gain an additional +1 minimum die value.

docs.title: Royal Roar
docs.text: The character's roar galvanizes action and intent. Effect: Once per scene, the character may reroll a Shout action.

docs.title: King's Shout
docs.text: The character inspires allies through commanding presence. Effect: Once per turn, the character may use a non-standard Shout simple action to grant all nearby allies d8 + mCHA Morale Points for the scene. This may be combined with a standard Shout action by spending a Free Action.

docs.title: Tyrant's Shout
docs.text: The character crushes enemy resolve through sheer dominance. Effect: Same as King's Shout, but instead removes the same amount of Morale Points from all nearby enemies. No defense or save applies. May be combined with a standard Shout action by spending a Free Action.

docs.title: Guardian's Shout
docs.text: The character shields allies through commanding warnings. Effect: Once per turn, the character may use a non-standard Shout simple action to grant all nearby allies a mark that gives advantage on their next defense action. The mark lasts until the character's next turn and affects the character as well. May be combined with a standard Shout action by spending a Free Action.

docs.title: Frenzy Shout
docs.text: The character spreads chaos and reckless aggression. Effect: Once per turn, the character may attempt a non-standard Shout simple action (Difficulty 15) to mark all nearby enemies, giving them disadvantage on their next defense action. The mark lasts until the character's next turn. May be combined with a standard Shout action by spending a Free Action.

docs.title: Speedster
docs.text: The character is accustomed to constant motion and rapid repositioning. Effect: The character may reroll speed-based movement tests and treats movement actions as familiar and routine.

docs.title: Fast to Act
docs.text: The character reacts instantly when conflict erupts. Effect: The character gains +10 Speed during the first round of a confrontation.

docs.title: Maniac
docs.text: The character pushes beyond normal limits in moments of frenzy. Effect: The character may act during a third round, suffering –20 to all actions and disadvantage on all tests. They may also borrow up to 10 Initiative from their next turn.

docs.title: Stability
docs.text: The character's stance is unwavering. Effect: The character may reroll balance-based tests. Initiative rolls have a minimum die value of 3 (cannot trigger singularities).

docs.title: Bull Stance
docs.text: The character plants themselves like an immovable force. Effect: Defense against knockdown and push effects is increased by +5.

docs.title: Danger Sense
docs.text: The character instinctively feels nearby threats. Effect: The character senses the presence of danger in the area. Hostile intentions are perceived only when an act is imminent or premeditated. If danger is nearby, the character can identify its source.

docs.title: Fear Sense
docs.text: The character senses fear as a tangible presence. Effect: The character perceives fear in the surrounding area and can identify its origin if it is nearby.

docs.title: Hornamental Magic Tradition
docs.text: The character channels magic through raw physical resilience. Effect: The character may choose CON as a free magic tradition attribute. Accessible domains are limited to Metal, War, and Law, with rare exceptions granted by story and GM discretion (up to MD).

docs.title: Affinity with Totem
docs.text: The character resonates naturally with their cultural totem. Effect: The character gains an Affinity linked to one attribute associated with their Totem. By default, a Totem provides two attributes.

docs.title: Align with Totem
docs.text:
Through ritual alignment, the character invokes their Totem's supernatural power. Cost: 1 PP Effect: Once per day, the character may use a Totem power a number of times equal to the Degrees of Success obtained on a Religion test performed the previous day (Difficulty 10; at least 1 Degree at 15).

  • FOR / CHA – Domination: The target suffers disadvantage on a test involving the character.
  • CON / VOL – Resilience: All disadvantages on a test are negated.
  • SAG / PER – Focus: The target loses all advantages on a test involving the character.
  • AGI / RUS – Guile: The target's advantages become disadvantages on a test involving the character.
  • DEX / INT – Coordination: The target loses one advantage, which the character gains for all resulting actions.

If the Totem grants the same power twice, it also provides: - Balance: The character gains advantage on a test.

docs.title: Erudition
docs.text: The character's accumulated knowledge can be recalled with precision. Effect: Once per day, the character may reroll an Erudition or Knowledge skill test.

docs.title: Bookworm
docs.text: The character can decipher almost any written language. Effect: The character can read all living or dead languages at a rudimentary level, understanding the subject but not the nuance. They gain a high bonus on reading attempts.

docs.title: Plagued
docs.text: The character's attacks carry a lingering corruption. Effect: When hit by the character's natural weapons, targets gain the Poison condition with a number of charges equal to the action's roll score. The target may attempt a Toughness test to reduce the charges (Difficulty based on mCON instead of mDEX). On a singularity, this may also apply to non-natural weapons.

docs.title: Malicious Expertise
docs.text: The character excels at inflicting lasting harm and debilitation. Effect: The character's Expertise is increased by +1 when applying conditions.

docs.title: Quick Feets
docs.text: The character moves with exceptional agility and lightness. Effect: Allure is increased by +1.

docs.title: Lightfoot
docs.text: The character barely disturbs the ground beneath them. Effect: Falling damage is halved. The character ignores walking penalties and terrain-based damage, provided they do not end their turn on damaging terrain.

docs.title: Long Reach
docs.text: The character's movements and strikes extend farther than expected. Effect: Reach is increased by +1 for all weapons.

docs.title: Excellent Speed
docs.text: The character's raw speed surpasses normal limits. Effect: Speed is increased by +2.

docs.title: Heart of Stead
docs.text: The character flows effortlessly through motion. Effect: The character gains one free Move action per scene and one free Step action per turn.

docs.title: Flutterstep
docs.text: The character dances through danger with instinctive grace. Effect: The character gains one free Dodge action per scene, and an additional free Dodge action usable only while flying.

docs.title: All Senses Out
docs.text: The character remains instinctively aware of their surroundings at all times. Effect: The character may always attempt an Acuity test regardless of circumstances (including sleep). They automatically gain access to an appropriate perception test without requiring an Intuition test to notice that something is wrong.

docs.title: All Eyes on Me
docs.text: The character's presence is impossible to ignore. Effect: The character cannot be forgotten. In confrontations, they may attempt one free emotion-based action per target (area-of-effect actions count each target).

docs.title: Karmic Vision
docs.text: The character perceives the hidden currents of fate and morality. Effect: The character may learn and use the Sixth Sense, allowing them to perceive a target's alignment, persona (temperament and character), and current resources.

docs.title: Supra Vision
docs.text: The character perceives how others perceive. Effect: The character may learn and use the Seventh Sense, allowing them to know whether they (or another target) are being seen, heard, or sensed.

docs.title: Living Wood
docs.text: The character's skin is composed of bark and living wood. Effect: The character gains 1 Resistance, 3 Absorption, and 1 Protection at all times, but is vulnerable to fire.

docs.title: Natural Armor
docs.text: The character's body provides inherent protection. Effect: The character possesses Category 1 natural armor.

docs.title: Immaculate
docs.text: The character recovers with remarkable purity and efficiency. Effect: Recovery is increased by +1. Any Fatigue gained through healing is reduced by 1.

docs.title: Natural Regeneration
docs.text: The character's endurance replenishes continuously. Effect: The character recovers 2 Endurance (PE) per round while in a scene. This recovery may generate Fatigue normally. Outside of scenes, Endurance returns to maximum unless the character chooses to prevent it to avoid Fatigue.

docs.title: Full Recovery
docs.text: The character's overall recovery capacity is exceptional. Effect: Recovery is increased by +2.

docs.title: Restless
docs.text: The character endures strain longer than most. Effect: Fatigue threshold is increased by +2.

docs.title: Keep Best
docs.text: Luck favors the character even when fate is rewritten. Effect: When rerolling dice through Karma or reroll effects, the character keeps the best result between the original and the new roll.

docs.title: Above Average
docs.text: The character's failures are rarely complete. Effect: Any die showing a 1 is treated as a 2 instead. This effect may trigger singularities normally and may be ignored voluntarily.

docs.title: Second Chance Gambit
docs.text: The character dares one final attempt when all others would stop. Effect: Once per day, the character may retry a failed action that normally forbids retries. A second failure results in aggravated consequences or additional Fatigue. The character gains a moderate bonus to the relevant skill for this attempt.

docs.title: Initial Flow
docs.text: The character enters scenes already in motion. Effect: The character starts every scene with 1 temporary Chi (PC), increased to 2 in confrontation scenes.

docs.title: Cautious
docs.text: The character avoids disastrous mistakes through careful restraint. Effect: The critical failure threshold is increased by 5 (a failure of 15+ is required to trigger a critical failure).

docs.title: Mind of Nature
docs.text: The character's mind is deeply attuned to natural patterns. Effect: All mental attributes gain +2, while Strength and Constitution suffer a –4 penalty.

docs.title: Motionless
docs.text: The character remains unmoved by emotional manipulation. Effect: Defenses against emotion-based actions are increased by +5, and such actions cannot critically succeed against the character.

docs.title: Too Pretty To Hit
docs.text: The character's allure disrupts hostile intent. Effect: Defenses are increased by +2 against enemies who may be attracted to the character, or +3 if the target is actively seduced for the scene. Defenses are reduced by –1 against others. Applies to both physical and mental situations.

docs.title: Guile
docs.text: The character instinctively compensates for their weaknesses. Effect: The character's lowest defenses are increased by +2.

docs.title: Vigilance
docs.text: The character anticipates retaliation. Effect: Defenses against counterattacks are increased by +2.

docs.title: Totem Carving
docs.text: The character carves symbolic totems infused with fortune. Effect: By spending a small activity, the character may carve a totem linked to a specific activity. The bearer may shatter it to reroll a skill test. Totems have no monetary value. Crafting Difficulty 15; on a critical success, the totem may be used twice.

docs.title: Charm Carving
docs.text: The character creates charms bound to individuals. Effect: As Totem Carving, but applies to a specific person and allows rerolling a Save instead of a skill test.

docs.title: Tattoo
docs.text: The character bears a meaningful tattoo tied to mastery. Effect: The clumsiness range for tests using a specific skill is reduced by 1.

docs.title: Improved Tattoo
docs.text: The tattoo's power is refined and intensified. Cost: 1 PP Effect: The exploit range of the tattoo's skill is increased by +1, stackable up to a maximum final range of 6.

docs.title: Training
docs.text: The character receives structured martial instruction. Effect: The character gains one level of training in melee weapons, ranged weapons, or armor.

docs.title: Improved Training
docs.text: The character broadens their martial expertise. Effect: The character gains two levels of training across two different choices among melee weapons, ranged weapons, or armor.

docs.title: Celestial Light
docs.text: Sunlight sustains the character's celestial nature. Effect: After a few minutes of sunlight exposure, the character's needs for sleep, food, and water are halved. Daily recovery requires only half the normal rest duration.

docs.title: Celestial Heart
docs.text: A divine core shields the character from corruption and despair. Effect: Corruption maximum is increased by +2. Saves against sickness, venom, poison, and toxins gain advantage. Self Morale is increased by +2.

docs.title: Eternal Youth
docs.text: Time barely touches the character's body. Effect: Physical aging progresses at one year per ten years after reaching maturity, maintaining peak condition indefinitely.

docs.title: Flight Movement
docs.text: The character's aerial form is both swift and protected. Effect: Allure is increased by +2 while flying, and passive defense against all magic is increased by +2.

docs.title: Windborne
docs.text: The character masters the skies. Effect: The character gains perfect flight maneuverability and +1 passive defense when flying high above the ground.

docs.title: Waterborne
docs.text: The character moves flawlessly underwater. Effect: The character gains perfect swimming maneuverability and +1 passive defense while fully submerged.

docs.title: Whimsical Magic Tradition
docs.text: The character channels magic through chance and unpredictability. Effect: The character may choose LUK as a free tradition attribute. Accessible domains are limited to Illusion, Charm, and Chaos, with rare narrative exceptions.

docs.title: Celestial Powers
docs.text: Celestials wield ideal-driven magic rooted in abstract virtues. Cost: 1 PP Effect: The character selects one Edict (ideal). Spells aligned with that Edict gain advantage and are reinforced. Edicts are morally neutral and represent rigid cosmic principles such as Justice, Balance, or Order.

docs.title: Chromatic Blood
docs.text: The character's blood carries latent chromatic energy. Effect: Each day, the character gains up to 5 + mEQU Chroma Points, which may be spent to prevent Endurance loss.

docs.title: Natural Resistance
docs.text: The character resists energies tied to their chromatic nature. Effect: The character gains light resistance to all domains and energies linked to their kind or color.

docs.title: Surnatural Resistance
docs.text: The character's resistances deepen beyond the mundane. Effect: All natural resistances are upgraded from light to medium.

docs.title: Dragon Breath
docs.text: The character unleashes raw elemental force. Effect: As Dragon Powers, but limited to a cone-shaped effect using an energy tied to the chosen domain.

docs.title: Dragon Powers
docs.text:
Cost: 1 PP Drakkans carry within their veins a diluted echo of true draconic power. Where true dragons wield Chromatic Power directly through their dragon heart—an overwhelming, primordial force—Drakkans can only access a minute fragment of that power through their blood. This fragment allows them to invoke crude yet potent magical phenomena tied to a specific chromatic domain. Though vastly inferior to true dragons in mastery and magnitude, this inherited magic remains instinctive, raw, and difficult to counter through conventional arcane means.

Effect: Chroma Points granted by Chromatic Blood may be spent to invoke Dragonic Powers. These powers represent Chromatic Magic, a fast but simple form of magic distinct from spellcasting.

  • As a Simple Action, once per turn, the character may produce a spell-like phenomenon based on a simple spell from the chromatic domain associated with their blood.
  • Most Drakkan types are tied to a predefined set of domains. This choice is made at character creation and cannot be changed later.
  • Balance (EQU) is used to perform the test associated with Dragonic Powers.
  • A dedicated skill group and skill may be learned to improve the odds of successfully invoking these powers.

Dragonic Powers may be used at spell level 0, increased by +1 spell level for every 4 character ranks.

Magical tools do not function properly with Dragonic Powers. However, the character may still add their rank to the power's roll as if using an appropriate magical tool, regardless of the power's level.

The Chroma Point cost of a Dragonic Power is equal to the minimum mana cost of a comparable spell and cannot be reduced by any means. The action difficulty is also based on that same comparable spell.

Dragonic Powers are not spells: - They cannot be countered. - They are not treated as regular spells. - They are unaffected by arcane actions or effects that specifically interact with spells.

Depending on the Drakkan type, Chroma Points may alternatively be spent as if they were another resource: - Red: Rage - Blue: Chi - Green: Guard - Yellow: Adrenaline - Purple: Mana - Black: Vitality - White: Karma - Grey: Spirituality

docs.title: High Natural Regeneration
docs.text: The character's body regenerates at an extreme rate, far beyond normal biological limits. Effect: This functions as Natural Regeneration, but all recovered values are doubled.

docs.title: Reserve Stock
docs.text: The character's body instinctively stores surplus energy for later use. Effect: When resting, excess recovery may be stored at a 1:3 ratio. Stored resources may reach up to 10% of the character's current maximum.

docs.title: Last Stand
docs.text: The character refuses to fall even when pushed beyond mortal limits. Effect: While Vitality (PV) is negative, the character gains medium resistance to all physical damage. While Spirituality (PS) is negative, the character gains medium resistance to all mental damage. The character may also ignore up to the first two levels of wounds and traumas.

docs.title: Fatigueless
docs.text: The character shrugs off strain more easily than others. Effect: Stress gained is always reduced by 1.

docs.title: Oversized Tool Bearer
docs.text: The character can wield equipment far larger than what their size would normally allow. Effect: The character may use Category 7 items (tools, armor, and weapons), which are typically custom-made.

docs.title: Steady Hands
docs.text: The character maintains firm control even over unwieldy equipment. Effect: The required grip for weapons is reduced by 3.

docs.title: Resourceful
docs.text: The character always finds a way to make do with what is available. Effect: The character can always find or improvise a usable weapon or tool in their surroundings and is considered trained in all improvised weapons and tools. Common sense and context determine applicability.

docs.title: Not Picky
docs.text: The character is accustomed to using subpar equipment. Effect: Penalties caused by item degradation or poor-quality equipment are reduced by 1.

docs.title: Scavenger
docs.text: The character excels at reclaiming value from the aftermath of conflict. Effect: When recycling, harvesting, or looting money from defeated enemies, the amount gained is increased by 10%. Context and logic apply.

docs.title: Debt of Pain
docs.text: The character temporarily defers suffering, pushing pain aside through sheer will. Effect: Once per scene, when receiving damage, the character may use a reaction to ignore that damage for the duration of the scene. The ignored damage (before penetration or mitigation) is recorded. At the end of the scene, the character suffers the recorded damage as piercing damage, ignoring armor and protection. If an Endurance test is successful, this use does not count against the once-per-scene limit. Applies to both physical and mental damage.

docs.title: Strongness
docs.text: The character's physiology and mindset blunt harmful effects while amplifying beneficial ones. Effect: Negative conditions are applied with 2 fewer charges, while positive conditions are applied with 2 additional charges.

docs.title: Scapegoats
docs.text: The character instinctively draws blame and hostility onto themselves. Effect: The character may attempt to take responsibility for a situation, redirecting blame toward themselves. Affected targets may resist with an Insight save against the character's mental expertise. In confrontations, this requires a Simple Action. Enemies who ignore this effect and continue targeting their original objective suffer disadvantage on their tests. This functions as a provocation without requiring a direct opposed roll.

docs.title: Coward Insights
docs.text: The character survives by redirecting danger rather than confronting it directly. Effect: Once per scene, when targeted by an attack, the character may redirect it to an adjacent willing ally. The new target may defend normally.

docs.title: Courageous Presence
docs.text: The character's resolve inspires others in tense situations. Effect: During confrontations, the character grants +1 Morale.

docs.title: Miserable Presence
docs.text: The character's suffering is contagious, but fuels their own determination. Effect: During confrontations, the character grants –1 Morale to others, but gains +2 Morale themselves.

docs.title: Terrible Presence
docs.text: The character radiates oppression and despair. Effect: During confrontations, the character grants –1 Morale and additionally reduces enemy Morale by 2.

docs.title: Wild Urges
docs.text: The character's primal drives surge far beyond restraint. Effect: Maximum Rage, Guard, or Adrenaline is increased by +4. At the start of a scene, the character may begin with 4 + mCON points in one of these resources.

docs.title: Animosity
docs.text:
The character harbors a deep and enduring hatred toward a specific category of creatures, often rooted in ancestral conflicts, cultural trauma, or personal history. This animosity sharpens both their aggression and their vigilance when dealing with such foes. Effect: The character gains a +1 bonus to all battle tests aimed at attacking, defending, or applying tactical moves against targets belonging to the chosen creature type.

When selecting this particularity, choose one of the following Animosity types:

  • Human Animosity — Targets the human race.
  • Elf Animosity — Targets the elven race.
  • Dwarf Animosity — Targets the dwarven race.
  • Feral Animosity — Targets feral peoples and feral creatures.
  • Vermin Animosity — Targets vermin races, including their monstrous variants.
  • Magic Animosity — Targets creatures considered magical, typically those possessing a magic-related attribute.
  • Spawn Animosity — Targets spawn-like creatures: servile or identity-less beings such as underdark engence and, more broadly, undead.
  • Monster Animosity — Targets monsters of all kinds.
  • Beast Animosity — Targets creatures of the animal kingdom, including feral beasts.

Animosity applies whenever the target clearly belongs to the selected category, as determined by the GM.

docs.title: Particularities: Instincts
docs.text:
Instincts represent a form of heightened, almost supernatural perception focused on a specific topic. They do not provide precise information, but rather a constant, intuitive awareness.

Common Effects (all Instincts): - The character gains advantage on tests made to track, spot, identify, or interpret their Instinct's topic. - Within an area equal to Attribute × 1 m², the character always knows whether a subject related to the Instinct's topic is nearby, though not its exact location. - The governing Attribute is defined by the Instinct and is either Wisdom or Cunning.

docs.title: Pack Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively perceives those they consider part of their pack, sensing presence, distress, and cohesion without conscious effort. Topic: Allies.

docs.title: Feline Instincts
docs.text: The character intuitively perceives subtle routes, hidden angles, and indirect paths that allow bypassing obstacles through agility, positioning, or verticality rather than brute force. Topic: Implicit paths, bypasses, climbs, and agile routes around obstacles.

docs.title: King Instincts
docs.text: The character instinctively senses figures of authority, dominance, or influence, perceiving not only their presence but also the nuances of their power and legitimacy. Topic: Leaders, powerful individuals, authority figures, and influence structures.

docs.title: Survival Instincts
docs.text: The character's instincts constantly scan their surroundings for anything that could preserve life or avert imminent death. Topic: Survival-relevant elements such as food, water, shelter, tools, and immediate solutions to mortal danger.

docs.title: Hunting Instinct
docs.text: The character perceives prey through signs, patterns, and weakness, entering a focused state when pursuing a target as part of a deliberate hunt. Topic: Prey being hunted, including non-bestial targets when framed as a ritualized hunt.

docs.title: Freedom Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively senses opportunities to escape, break free, or avoid confinement, without relying on physical bypasses like climbing or squeezing. Topic: Means of escape, liberation, or avoidance of capture and restraint.

docs.title: Alert Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively detects threats that are concealed or about to strike. Topic: Ambushes, traps, and hidden hostile beings.

docs.title: Bestial Instincts
docs.text: The character perceives primal behaviors, dominance cues, and instinct-driven intentions in creatures acting on raw impulse. Topic: Instinctual, animalistic behaviors and reactions.

docs.title: Oath Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively senses the presence and weight of spoken bonds, promises, and vows. Topic: Oaths, promises, pacts, and the relationships created by binding words.

docs.title: Venal Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively senses the presence of wealth and objects of material value. Topic: Lootable wealth such as gold, gems, precious items, and valuables.

docs.title: Watery Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively perceives water in all its manifestations and movements. Topic: Water sources, currents, humidity, and bodies of water in any form.

docs.title: Unknown Instinct
docs.text: The character feels the presence of things that are unexplored, hidden, or not yet understood. Topic: Unknown, undiscovered, or unexplained elements.

docs.title: Blood Instincts
docs.text: The character instinctively senses spilled blood and its lingering traces. Topic: Shed blood, blood trails, and evidence of injury or violence.

docs.title: Curious Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively notices what is out of place, unusual, or worthy of investigation. Topic: Strange, curious, or abnormal elements.

docs.title: Practical Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively focuses on useful information and actionable clues. Topic: Practical information, evidence, and meaningful clues.

docs.title: Furious Instincts
docs.text: The character senses rising violence and emotional volatility, as well as places marked by recent or habitual bloodshed. Topic: Imminent violence, uncontrolled anger, emotional outbursts, recent fights, and lingering violent tension.

docs.title: Malicious Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively detects cold or calculated intent to cause harm. Topic: Malicious intent, betrayal, manipulation, corruption, and moral decay.

docs.title: Vermin Instinct
docs.text: The character instinctively perceives the presence and dynamics of the weak, submissive, or easily manipulated. Topic: Minions, underlings, powerless individuals, and highly influenceable people.

docs.title: Affinity
docs.text:
An Affinity represents a situational harmony between the character and a specific environment, context, or mode of action. When conditions are met, the character performs more efficiently at critical moments.

Common Effect (all Affinities): When a test performed under the conditions of an Affinity results in a Singularity, the character gains a +1 bonus to that test.

  • Multiple Affinities may apply to the same test and can stack.
  • Affinities only apply when the fictional conditions are clearly met, as determined by the GM.

docs.title: Environmental Affinities
docs.text:
• Forest Affinity — Lush, forested, or overgrown environments; urban gardens also qualify.
  • Plains Affinity — Open plains or wide empty spaces; large areas devoid of notable scenery also qualify.
  • Desertic Affinity — Arid or barren environments; completely empty spaces also qualify.
  • Cold Affinity — Cold environments, natural or artificial.
  • Heat Affinity — Hot environments, natural or artificial.
  • Mountain Affinity — Mountainous, rocky, or cliffside environments.
  • Subterranean Affinity — Underground environments such as caves, tunnels, and caverns.
  • Filth Affinity — Extremely dirty or polluted environments (sewers, swamps, refuse-filled areas).
  • Water Affinity — Flooded or humid environments; rain, shores, or full immersion always qualify.
  • Height Affinity — Elevated environments or situations involving vertical dominance.
  • Big Affinity — Vast or disproportionate spaces; applies only against large targets (Size 15+).
  • Small Affinity — Tight or cramped environments; applies only against small targets (Size 5 or lower).
  • Darkness Affinity — Very dark environments defined by strong shadow contrast, even during daytime.
  • Light Affinity — Extremely bright environments with strong light contrast, including direct sunlight.
  • Calm Affinity — Silent and calm environments; any noise, including the character's own, breaks the condition.
  • Road Affinity — Travel situations, journeys, nomadic movement, or being “on the road.”
  • Dream Affinity — Dreamscapes and oneiric environments.
  • Field Affinity — Large-scale battlefields involving multiple groups and widespread conflict.
  • Origin-Specific Environment Affinity — An environment strongly tied to the character's origin or culture.

docs.title: Situational & Behavioral Affinities
docs.text:
• Pack Affinity — Presence of nearby allies.
  • Barehands Affinity — Actions performed unarmed or using natural weapons.
  • Flanking Affinity — Actions performed against a flanked opponent.
  • Prudence Affinity — Actions that result in clumsiness or similar negative singularities.
  • Chasing Affinity — Pursuits, chases, and sustained running actions.
  • Rivalry Affinity — Actions that clearly reinforce an established rivalry.
  • Honor and Oath Affinity — Actions taken to uphold vows, promises, rules, or personal honor.
  • Blood Affinity — Actions involving blood: sensing, tracking, identifying, or exploiting it.
  • Curiosity Affinity — Actions driven by curiosity or investigation.
  • Ingenious Affinity — Actions based on clever planning, ruses, or innovative ideas.
  • City Affinity — Actions tied to the notable structure or nature of an urban environment.
  • Distance Affinity — Actions involving significant distance; ranged attacks only apply at long range or beyond.
  • Ambidextry Affinity — Actions performed using the non-dominant hand.
  • Immaterial Affinity — Actions involving magic or intangible forces.
  • Perfectionist Affinity — Actions using skills of rank 3 or higher and contributing to improvement or refinement.
  • Motion Affinity — Actions tied to emotions or emotional expression.
  • Battle Affinity — Actions related to warfare or combat context, excluding direct combat actions.
  • Art Affinity — Actions related to artistic creation or expression.
  • Vengeance Affinity — Actions taken to fulfill revenge.
  • Luck Affinity — Actions involving Karma usage.
  • Order Affinity — Actions that uphold rules, commands, or obligations.
  • Chaos Affinity — Actions opposing authority, disobeying orders, or rejecting structure.
  • Selfishness Affinity — Actions that benefit only the character, even in the long term.
  • Community Affinity — Actions that benefit others but not the character.

docs.title: Combat Affinities
docs.text:
• Unarmored Affinity — Combat actions performed while wearing no armor (natural armor does not count).
  • Wounded Affinity — Combat actions targeting a wounded opponent (beyond superficial scratches).
  • Pristine Affinity — Combat actions while all primary resources are at maximum, including Endurance.
  • Slow Affinity — Combat actions against a single target performed after that target's turn.
  • Quick Affinity — Combat actions against a single target performed before that target's turn.
  • Resistance Affinity — Defensive actions.

docs.title: Material & Craft Affinities
docs.text:
• Metal Affinity — Actions involving metal work, identification, or observation.
  • Stone Affinity — Actions involving stone or rock.
  • Leather Affinity — Actions involving leather or hides.
  • Fabric Affinity — Actions involving cloth or textiles.
  • Mineral Affinity — Actions involving minerals or gemstones.
  • Poison Affinity — Actions involving poisons, venoms, or toxic substances.
  • Wood Affinity — Actions involving wood.

docs.title: Knowledge & Technique Affinities
docs.text:
• Knowledge Affinity — Actions involving knowledge or learning.
  • Code Affinity — Actions aligned with the character's personal code of honor.
  • Altitude Affinity — Actions performed from a height relative to the target or objective.
  • Repair Affinity — Actions aimed at repairing objects or structures.
  • Arcane Affinity — Actions involving arcane principles.
  • Science Affinity — Actions involving scientific methods or reasoning.
  • Technology Affinity — Actions involving technological devices or systems.
  • Magic Affinity — Actions involving magical effects or spellcasting.

docs.title: Risk & Conflict Affinities
docs.text:
• Thievery Affinity — Actions involving illegal or illicit activities.
  • Food Affinity — Actions involving food preparation, acquisition, or consumption.
  • Sacrifice Affinity — Actions that benefit others while causing loss or hardship to the character.
  • Oratory Affinity — Actions performed before an audience capable of judging the outcome.
  • Custom Affinity — Actions related to customs, beliefs, etiquette, or traditions.
  • Adaptative Affinity — Actions taken after changing approach following failure or obstruction.
  • Peril Affinity — Actions taken while facing potentially lethal danger.
  • Strive Affinity — Actions attempted in a weakened or tactically delicate situation.
  • Adversity Affinity — Actions with very low objective chances of success; applies when Difficulty is 20+.
  • Escape Affinity — Actions aimed at fleeing or avoiding danger.
  • Treachery Affinity — Actions involving deception, cheating, or betrayal.

docs.title: Dark Surge
docs.text:
A dark shard dwells within dark elves, a suffocating echo that dims the natural glow of life in their soul. This shadow is present from birth but remains dormant until adolescence, when it begins to actively consume its host. At that age, dark elven youths are inevitably claimed—by consent or by force—by the secretive organization that governs their people and teaches them how to survive with this inner darkness. When mastered, the shard grants terrifying efficiency; when neglected, it leads swiftly to ruin.

Effect: The character gains an initial +2 bonus to Initiative.

After each Long Rest, once all normal recoveries have been applied, the character gains 1d8 Corruption. The character may then attempt a Determination save against a Difficulty equal to their current Shadow Threshold (0 by default).

The result of this save modifies the Corruption gained: - Critical Success: No Corruption gained - Success: Corruption gained is reduced by 50% - Failure: Full Corruption gained - Critical Failure: Corruption gained is increased by 50%

All values are rounded up.

After resolving this test, the character’s Shadow Threshold increases by 1.

Each time the character participates in a Confrontation, their Shadow Threshold also increases by 1.

If the character dies as a result of Corruption, they do not perish normally. Instead, they transform into a Creature of Shadow, an aberration of overwhelming violence and power—an outcome greatly feared by all who know of the Dark Surge.

To mitigate the Dark Surge, the character may consume a dose of Thaïs Flowers, reducing their Shadow Threshold by 1d8. Each dose costs 1 gold piece.

docs.text:

Il anticipe les dangers avant qu’ils ne se manifestent pleinement, renforçant ses défenses passives, réagissant avec une grande efficacité en défense active et libérant ses décharges avec une intensité accrue.
